results.title: Planning for personal and professional growth
results.creator_credit: George L. George, Sturgis-Grant Productions and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Planning for Teaching”.
Shows how teachers need to maintain their own mental growth and resilience to make the most of teaching. Dramatises cases of four typical teachers to explain how a teacher can avoid failure and frustration, and give inspiration instead of boredom to their charges. Stresses that teachers need to make conscious effort to deepen their understanding.

results.title: Planning for Melbourne's future
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Cine Service
results.brief_description: In 1949 the Melbourne Metropolitan Board of Works was asked to formulate a plan that would estimate the future needs of Melbourne. From information gathered through surveys, inspecting every street and alley to determine its use, this was made possible. “Planning for Melbourne’s Future” is photographed and directed by Geoffrey Thompson and is an examination of this plan. It is a rare and honest account of the deficiencies and lack of planning made to prepare Melbourne for an increase in future population growth.

results.title: Planning and laying out work
results.creator_credit: J Studebaker, United States. Office of Education and Mode-Art Pictures
results.brief_description: A number of dramatised incidents emphasise the importance of careful planning before starting a job; the serious results of poor planning, or no planning at all, are demonstrated.

results.title: Planning and goal setting: time waste or management tool
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, Fred H Joiner, Ameron and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Explores the advantages and disadvantages of economic forecasts and business plans, various practicalities and difficulties to overcome and how to overcome them. Also considers the costs and benefits of planning yourself, or out-sourcing professional planners.

results.title: Planning a water harvesting project
results.brief_description: Certain aspects of the water harvesting project developed at the Sydney University Farm, Badgery’s Creek. Describes the essential needs on an average farm and shows the construction of storage dams, various irrigation systems available, and the correct application of irrigation to pastures.

results.creator_credit: Gerry North and Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Planning a programme
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Harris Watts and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: An introduction to the basic techniques of recording an event on camera. In the first section a humorous dramatization of a retirement ceremony shows how not to do it. The second section shows how these mistakes can be easily avoided by proper research and planning. A series of graphics is used to demostrate how the program-makers can organize the positioning of camera, lights and participants well in advance of filming. The tape ends with a shorter, punchier, much improved version of thr ceremony.

results.title: Planning a city
results.brief_description: Sydney, the second greatest white city in the British Empire. A critical analysis of Sydney and the initial lack of city planning. Despite the surrounding beauty and the opportunity for wise planning, Sydney became a crowded and poorly serviced city. Many houses were built on narrow, cramped and dimly lit streets which contributed to the escalation of crime and disease. Those responsible for constructing roadways rarely considered the impact on residents. Many schools and shopping centres were built on major thoroughfares resulting in a high rate of school children and housewives being killed by cars. Considering the harbourside location, many of the views became obstructed by buildings housing the privileged. The ‘Town and Country Planning Act of 1945’ was introduced to provide an opportunity to remedy the mistakes of the past by planning for future improvements. This film includes scenes of Sydney as it was in the middle of this century and what is now historical footage of cars, buses, trams, trains, ferries and horse and carts.

results.title: Planning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Job Catch”.
A successful job application is dependent on careful preparation and presentation of academic record, work experience and related activities. It also requires a clear understanding of the job and the reasons for applying. “Planning” presents an easy to follow guide on how to prepare job applications. It discusses the following three points : 1.Preparation of reports, references, resumes and letters; 2.Knowledge of the job; 3.How to present a clear description of one’s self to the employer.
